definition[0]: growth that it is not possible to SUSTAIN (=make continue) without causing economic problems
example[0]: Even the health-care industry, which created 425,000 jobs in the past year, will eventually slow its unsustainable growth as efforts to cut costs take effect.
definition[1]: economic growth that it is not possible to sustain without causing environmental problems
example[1]: Ever since Malthus forecast a population explosion among the poor, there have been prophecies of unsustainable growth.
